item.title: Java Language Specification, ยง19
item.author: James Gosling
Bill Joy
Guy Steele
item.comment: The original JLS1. The link points to app1 grammar source.

item.title: Java Language Specification, Second Edition, ยง18
item.author: James Gosling
Bill Joy
Guy Steele
Gilad Bracha
item.comment: The original JLS2. The link points to app2 grammar source.

item.title: Java Language Specification, Third Edition, ยง18
item.author: James Gosling
Bill Joy
Guy Steele
Gilad Bracha
item.comment: The original JLS3. The link points to app3 grammar source.

item.title: Java Language Grammar
item.author: Richard J. Botting
item.comment: The grammar is in the author's XBNF format that we don't have an extractor in the SLPS yet.

item.title: JLS LALR(1) Grammar
item.author: Neng-Fa Zhou
Sosuke Kaneko
Kouji Yamauchi
item.comment: A part of the project called DJ (Declarative Java).

item.title: CS118: yacc Java Grammar
item.author: Dmitri Bronnikov
Bill McKeeman
item.comment: Contains some updates to Java 1.1 (which is covered by Arnold/Gosling book, not by any JLS).

item.title: Java parser and tree parser
item.author: John Lilley
John Mitchell
Terence Parr
Scott Stanchfield
item.comment: The grammar corresponds to Java 3, which is a bit more than JLS2. In fact, the only reason J2SE 1.3 was not standardised is because it had too few changes from J2SE 1.2.

item.title: The Java JLS2 Grammar
item.author: Gaute Lykkenborg
item.comment: Very fancy heavily hyperlinked and coloured HTML. The grammar definition formalism was made compliant with ISO/IEC 14977:1996 standard. Which changes/fixes were applied, if any, is unknown.

item.title: The Java JLS3 Grammar
item.author: Gaute Lykkenborg
item.comment: Very fancy heavily hyperlinked and coloured HTML. The grammar definition formalism was made compliant with ISO/IEC 14977:1996 standard. Which changes/fixes were applied, if any, is unknown.

item.title: Java 1.5 grammar for ANTLR v3 that builds trees
item.author: Dieter Habelitz
item.comment: Not derived from other ANTLR Java grammars, relation to JLS unknown.

item.title: Java 1.5 grammar for ANTLR v3
item.author: Terence Parr
item.comment: Claimed to be 'derived from spec', 'very clean' and 'pretty fast'.

item.title: Java 5 (aka 1.5) grammar update
item.author: Michael Studman
item.comment: One of the most used ANTLR Java grammars, an update to the 1.3 grammar by Lilley/Mitchell/Parr/Stanchfield.

item.title: yet another java 1.5 grammar
item.author: Michael Stahl
item.comment: Developed independently from the one by Michael Studman.

item.title: Updated Java 1.5 Grammar
item.author: Scott Wisniewski
item.comment: Claimed to be based on Studman's one, but with 'better conformance to the Java Language Specification'.

item.title: Java 1.5 + Java preprocessor
item.author: Luca Colombi
item.comment: Based on the one by Wisniewski, but 'adapted to compile without error also in eclipse with antlr plugin and jdk 1.5'.

item.title: Java 1.5 Syntax (corrected)
item.author: Richard Bosworth
item.comment: This is the only grammar that claims to fix all errors and still not go beyond that. See the next link for their bugreport to Sun.

item.title: Bug ID: 6442525 Syntax specification (section 18) is inconsistent with other sections
item.author: Richard Bosworth
item.comment: Even that the title claims to spot differences between app3 and doc3 grammars, some of the issues being reported say that both are incorrect.
